// Get the collection of attachments that are contained in the email context.Properties["EmailAttachments"] = context.Data.Email.Attachments; //Check for invalid characters in the subject of the email before setting the target filename System.Text.RegularExpressions.Regex InvalidFileRegex = new System.Text.RegularExpressions.Regex( string.Format("[{0}]", System.Text.RegularExpressions.Regex.Escape(@"<>:""/\|?*"))); string emailSubject = InvalidFileRegex.Replace(context.Data.Email.Subject, string.Empty); // Set the target filename to the subject of the email context.Data.SetProperty("file_out", "Name", emailSubject); // Create a new message from a clone of the original context.Data = context.Data.Clone(false); // Now set the body using the bytes property and set the message properties context.Data.Bytes = attachment.Content; // Write out the contents of the attachment in the logs as a string context.Instance.TraceInformation(context.Data.ToString()); context.Data.SetProperty("email","ContentType",attachment.ContentType); context.Data.SetProperty("email","Encoding",attachment.Encoding); context.Data.SetProperty("email","Name",attachment.Name); context.Data.SetProperty("email", "CharacterSet", attachment.CharacterSet); context.Data.SetProperty("email", "Length", attachment.Length.ToString()); // Set the dynamic outbound property for the file adapter context.Data.SetProperty("file_out", "Name", attachment.Name); // If you want to write the attachment directly to a file: //System.IO.File.WriteAllBytes(@"C:\FileOut\" + attachment.Name, attachment.Content);
